trans-unit.source: Using the SAP Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the SAP Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the SAP Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the SAP Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the SAP Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the SAP Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Connect to on-premises SAP to call RFC or get metadata.
trans-unit.target: Connect to on-premises SAP to call RFC or get metadata.

trans-unit.source: There are scenarios where you may need to work with SAP, which is installed on-premises and behind the firewall.
trans-unit.target: There are scenarios where you may need to work with SAP, which is installed on-premises and behind the firewall.

trans-unit.source: By leveraging the SAP Connector in your flow, you can achieve a variety of scenarios.
trans-unit.target: By leveraging the SAP Connector in your flow, you can achieve a variety of scenarios.

trans-unit.source: A few examples:
trans-unit.target: A few examples:

trans-unit.source: Expose a section of the data residing in your SAP via a web or mobile user front end.
trans-unit.target: Expose a section of the data residing in your SAP via a web or mobile user front end.

trans-unit.source: Publish data to your SAP after due processing
trans-unit.target: Publish data to your SAP after due processing

trans-unit.source: Extract data from SAP for use in a business process
trans-unit.target: Extract data from SAP for use in a business process

trans-unit.source: Connectors can be used in Logic apps to fetch, process or push data as a part of a flow.
trans-unit.target: Connectors can be used in Logic apps to fetch, process or push data as a part of a flow.

trans-unit.source: You can add the SAP Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the SAP Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: For these scenarios, the following needs to be done:
trans-unit.target: For these scenarios, the following needs to be done:

trans-unit.source: Create an instance of the SAP Connector API App
trans-unit.target: Create an instance of the SAP Connector API App

trans-unit.source: Establish hybrid connectivity for the API App to communicate with the on-premises SAP
trans-unit.target: Establish hybrid connectivity for the API App to communicate with the on-premises SAP

trans-unit.source: Use the created API App in a logic app to achieve the desired business process
trans-unit.target: Use the created API App in a logic app to achieve the desired business process

trans-unit.source: Create an instance of the SAP Connector API App
trans-unit.target: Create an instance of the SAP Connector API App

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure startboard, select **Marketplace**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure startboard, select **Marketplace**.

trans-unit.source: Search for “SAP Connector”, select it, and select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Search for “SAP Connector”, select it, and select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Configure it as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure it as follows:

trans-unit.source: Provide the generic details such as Name, App service plan, and so on in the first blade
trans-unit.target: Provide the generic details such as Name, App service plan, and so on in the first blade

trans-unit.source: As part of Package settings provide the SAP Credentials.
trans-unit.target: As part of Package settings provide the SAP Credentials.

trans-unit.source: Also provide an Azure Service Bus connection string.
trans-unit.target: Also provide an Azure Service Bus connection string.

trans-unit.source: This is used to establish hybrid connectivity with your on-premises SAP.
trans-unit.target: This is used to establish hybrid connectivity with your on-premises SAP.

trans-unit.source: RFCs, TRFCs, BAPIs and IDOCs need to be configured based on the scenario need.
trans-unit.target: RFCs, TRFCs, BAPIs and IDOCs need to be configured based on the scenario need.

trans-unit.source: If multiple values need to be provided then they can be separated by commas
trans-unit.target: If multiple values need to be provided then they can be separated by commas

trans-unit.source: Configure the just created SAP Connector API App
trans-unit.target: Configure the just created SAP Connector API App

trans-unit.source: Browse to the just created API App via Browse -> API Apps ->
trans-unit.target: Browse to the just created API App via Browse -> API Apps ->

trans-unit.source: and you see the following behavior.
trans-unit.target: and you see the following behavior.

trans-unit.source: The setup is incomplete as the hybrid connection is not yet established:
trans-unit.target: The setup is incomplete as the hybrid connection is not yet established:

trans-unit.source: The SAP Connector does require hybrid connectivity to connect to *any* SAP endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The SAP Connector does require hybrid connectivity to connect to *any* SAP endpoint.

trans-unit.source: To establish hybrid connectivity, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To establish hybrid connectivity, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Copy the primary connection string
trans-unit.target: Copy the primary connection string

trans-unit.source: Click on the 'Download and Configure' link
trans-unit.target: Click on the 'Download and Configure' link

trans-unit.source: Follow the install process which gets initiated and provide the primary connection string when asked for
trans-unit.target: Follow the install process which gets initiated and provide the primary connection string when asked for

trans-unit.source: Once the setup process is complete, then a dialog similar to the following is displayed:
trans-unit.target: Once the setup process is complete, then a dialog similar to the following is displayed:

trans-unit.source: Now when you browse to the created API App again then you will observe the hybrid connection status as Connected:
trans-unit.target: Now when you browse to the created API App again then you will observe the hybrid connection status as Connected:

trans-unit.source: Note: in case you wish to switch to the secondary connection string then just re-do the hybrid setup and provide the secondary connection string in place of the primary connection string
trans-unit.target: Note: in case you wish to switch to the secondary connection string then just re-do the hybrid setup and provide the secondary connection string in place of the primary connection string

trans-unit.source: Usage in a Logic App
trans-unit.target: Usage in a Logic App

trans-unit.source: SAP Connector can be used as an action/step only in a logic app.
trans-unit.target: SAP Connector can be used as an action/step only in a logic app.

trans-unit.source: When creating/editing a logic app, choose the SAP Connector API App created above.
trans-unit.target: When creating/editing a logic app, choose the SAP Connector API App created above.

trans-unit.source: This lists all the permissible actions once can choose from:
trans-unit.target: This lists all the permissible actions once can choose from:

trans-unit.source: Upon selection of an action, it lists the input parameters for that action.
trans-unit.target: Upon selection of an action, it lists the input parameters for that action.

trans-unit.source: Provide the appropriate values and click on the Tick icon:
trans-unit.target: Provide the appropriate values and click on the Tick icon:

trans-unit.source: The step/action now appears as configured in the logic app.
trans-unit.target: The step/action now appears as configured in the logic app.

trans-unit.source: The output(s) of the operation will be shown and can be used inputs in a subsequent step:
trans-unit.target: The output(s) of the operation will be shown and can be used inputs in a subsequent step:

trans-unit.source: Complete the logic app to define the business process and then execute it to achieve the desired purpose.
trans-unit.target: Complete the logic app to define the business process and then execute it to achieve the desired purpose.

trans-unit.source: Do more with your Connector
trans-unit.target: Do more with your Connector

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
